other_tests.findings: An open prosthetic urethra was observed with brisk bleeding, making visualization of the bladder difficult. A fungating lesion at the anterior bladder neck with an adherent clot was partially excised.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Bleeding persisted after 5 days and required a transfer for further evaluation.

other_tests.findings: Adenocarcinoma in one of two cores from the right base (Gleason score 7) and in a core from the left lateral midportion (Gleason score 6).
A large fungating lesion and clot at the anterior bladder neck.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Flushing of the bladder and biopsies were performed.

other_tests.findings: Cystic mass (2.5 cm) in the anterior bladder neck and prostatic urethra, showing adenocarcinoma with pseudostratified tall columnar cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperative follow-up at 24 months showed no evidence of recurrent or metastatic cancer.
